title: Travis Kalanick Cuts Uber Stake by More Than 90%
summary: Former CEO has sold more than $2.5 billion in stock in recent weeks. Travis Kalanick's ride at Uber Technologies Inc. is nearing an end.

title: Bloomberg Expands Staffing Plan to More Battleground States
summary: Billionaire candidate plans to keep offices open through November election, even if he isn't nominee. PHILADELPHIA-Michael Bloomberg's campaign is planning to keep offices open and staffers employed through the November election-even if he isn't the nominee-in six battleground states President Trump swept in 2016, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: A Genius Leftover-Turkey Recipe: Your Reward for Thanksgiving Stress
summary: Toss what's left of your festive bird, bones and all, into a pot with some water and make a highly slurpable noodle soup. Some greens and a poached egg make it all the more satisfying. AFTER THE THANKSGIVING feasting has finished, here's what you do with all the leftover turkey: Give it a glorious second act in this nourishing soup, the second Slow Food Fast recipe from chef Johanne Killeen of Al Forno in Providence, R.I. Bolstered with Parmesan, capellini pasta, wilted greens and a poached egg, the rich broth provides precisely the sort of soothing you'll want in the brief recovery period between holidays.

title: U.S. Sanctions Halt Work on Russia's Gas Pipeline to Europe
summary: The pause comes hours after President Trump signed a bill targeting entities working on the project. BERLIN-U.S. sanctions have temporarily stopped the construction of a pipeline that is set to increase the flow of natural gas directly from Russia to Germany under the Baltic Sea.

title: In the Battles Over Trump's Trade Wars, Hawkish Adviser Navarro Endures
summary: Peter Navarro stays close to the president with a shared skepticism about China, trade. WASHINGTON-Outmaneuvered in an Oval Office discussion with other advisers, Peter Navarro trash-talked his opponents: "Globalists!"

title: Restaurants Unwrap a Christmas Eve Seven-Fishes Feast
summary: A traditionally home-cooked meal gets the dining-out treatment.

title: Russia, Ukraine Agree to Gas Flows to EU, as U.S. Sanctions Hit Pipeline Project
summary: The agreement secures steady supplies for Europe, amid concerns over its dependence on Russian natural gas. Russia and Ukraine clinched a transit agreement for gas deliveries to Europe, warding off massive disruptions in the new year and securing steady supplies, even as U.S. sanctions temporarily halted work on a new gas pipeline from Russia to Germany.

title: After Syria, Turkey Seeks to Partner With Russia in Libya
summary: Ankara, which supports U.N.-backed government in Tripoli, is wary of slipping into proxy war with Moscow. ISTANBUL-Weeks after forming a military partnership with Russia to share control of a land strip in northern Syria, Turkey is trying to convince the Kremlin to cooperate in another volatile country torn by civil war: Libya.

title: In Impeachment's Aftermath, House Is Even More Divided
summary: Lawmakers couldn't agree on how Congress should conduct oversight, or on how to treat one another.

title: Pakistani Professor Sentenced to Death for Blasphemy
summary: Junaid Hafeez was accused in 2013 of being behind anonymous posts on secular-orientated Facebook pages. ISLAMABAD-A university professor held for six years after being arrested for blasphemy over Facebook posts was sentenced to death Saturday by a Pakistani court in a case that has drawn international attention.

title: The Newest Trend in Holiday Gifting? Old Stuff
summary: Shoppers are buying secondhand apparel and accessories as gifts, citing price and environmental concerns; 'You might just want to wash it'. The final weekend before Christmas rivals Black Friday for the amount of money spent at stores. But this holiday season, a crop of e-commerce players gave shoppers new reasons to skip the mall.

title: BASF to Sell Construction Chemicals Business to Lone Star Funds
summary: The sale comes as BASF cuts jobs and slashes profit expectations as it battles to contend with slowing demand. BERLIN-Chemicals giant BASF said it has agreed to sell its construction chemicals unit for €3.17 billion ($3.52 billion), as the German company works to boost profitability through ongoing turnaround efforts.

title: Pope Says Church Must Adapt to Post-Christian West
summary: The pope's remarks echoed those of his predecessors who spoke of a "new evangelization" to revive the faith in historically Christian lands. ROME-The Catholic Church must adopt new approaches to evangelization in a post-Christian West, Pope Francis said in a Christmas message to Vatican officials.

title: Move Over, Santa! Kids Are Asking Alexa to Bring Them Presents
summary: Parents are learning the hard way to protect their Amazon accounts from kids; sending packages back can lead to tears. Zibby Owens was in therapy a few months ago when her phone started buzzing with notifications. They were texts from Amazon confirming that several "Paw Patrol" toys were en route to her house.

title: Warren Vows Lobbying Crackdown, But It Could Hit Roadblocks
summary: The Massachusetts Democrat wants to end the revolving door between government and the influence industry, ban lobbying for foreign governments.

title: 'The Renaissance of Etching' Review: Outlining a Revolutionary Technique
summary: The rise of etching around 1500 allowed artists to tackle an extraordinary range of subject matter..

title: Walmart's Secret Weapon to Fight Off Amazon: The Supercenter
summary: Walmart is betting on a future where its giant stores will quickly get groceries to your door, replace the doctor's office and rent out computing power to passing drones and autonomous cars. After years of internal debate about how to compete with Amazon.com Inc., Walmart Inc. boss Doug McMillon took the stage at a recent strategy meeting and revealed the centerpiece of his plan to thrive in an e-commerce era: giant stores.

title: A Day at the Abortion Clinic at the Center of the Supreme Court Case
summary: Resume Subscription. SHREVEPORT, La.-Women travel from all over the region for appointments at the only abortion clinic for about 200 miles. Protesters drive for hours to get here, too.

title: Debate Highlights a Three-Way Iowa Traffic Jam
summary: Pete Buttigieg, Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar trade barbs as they vie for advantage in presidential race. Debates have a way of clarifying where a race stands, and this week's Democratic presidential debate in California certainly performed that task.

title: 'OK Boomer': A Defining Generation Becomes a Label for Irrelevance
summary: After decades of outsize influence, baby boomers are getting taunted by a younger cohort in a bit of sly intergenerational warfare. As 2019 ends, various dictionary publishers are choosing their "Word of the Year," a term they believe has surged the most in usage and importance. The originator of this practice, the American Dialect Society, makes its choice on Jan. 3, and this time the gathering of scholars will also pick a "Word of the Decade."

title: The Leadership Case for Saving High-School Football
summary: A sport that needs to be made safer is also uniquely effective at teaching kids about teamwork and being a leader. Every year, the National Federation of State High School Associations tabulates how many U.S. high school students played sports, and which sports they played.
